result.execSummary:
The defendant Ricky Lee Thomas was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay DNA surcharge, if not previously done. Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

The first 14 days are straight time--the balance can be served with Huber for the Day Reporting Program--no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program. Provide a DNA sample and cannot vote until civil rights are restored.
Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm
Pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

The first 14 days are straight time--the balance can be served with Huber for the Day Reporting Program--no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program. Provide a DNA sample. 

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges.
Concurrent with: with Count 1 with 6 days credit

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ricky Lee Thomas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeds.  Statements by counsel and defendant.

Court advises the defendant may not possess a firearm; is to provide a DNA sample, and pay the DNA surcharge, if not previously done, and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  

Count 1:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 10 months at the House of Correction - the first 14 days are straight time - the balance can be served with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program and 6 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

Count 2:  COURT ORDERS defendant to serve 10 months at the House of Correction - concurrent with Count 1 - the first 14 days are straight time - the balance can be served with Huber for the Day Reporting Program - no objection to electronic monitoring while in the program and 6 days credit; pay costs, assessments and surcharges by 5-15-15 or a civil judgment is to be entered against the defendant and subject to other collection.

COURT ORDERS:
- defendant to provide a DNA sample and pay the surcharge, if not already done.

Court advises the defendant any possession or use of any illegally controlled substance or alcohol forfeits the release privileges. 

Appeal rights given.  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief and Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement received and filed.

Defendant Ricky Lee Thomas in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Nathaniel E Adamson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Defendant waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of GUILTY to Counts 1 & 2 and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum  received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty of Counts 1 & 2 as charged in the Information and enters a judgment of conviction.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Ricky Lee Thomas in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  Nathaniel E Adamson for William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds

Due to the lateness of the hour and defendant is unable to return in the afternoon, Court adjourns caes.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant Ricky Lee Thomas in court with attorney Gregory A Renden.  William Levins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Clerk;ds
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point report received and filed./ds

Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.

Defendant Ricky Lee Thomas in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Kevin Shomin for Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Fiorenza.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Konkol, Br. 44.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Report dated 4/7/14.
css

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING AND ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Ricky Lee Thomas in court with attorney Gregory A. Renden.  Defendant Ricky Lee Thomas in custody.  Karine E. O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge FIORENZA, Branch 3.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 8, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
